intro: Leptolepia novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand shield fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture. Leptolepia novae-zelandiae plays an important role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat for various small organisms.
